text: In his memoir, My Life,  Chagall recounted that the inspiration for The Poet and the Birds originated from his desire to create a painting in the style of Camille Corot (1796-1875), one of the most influential painters of the Barbizon school. "A landscape à la Corot, why not' I took a photograph, but the more I tried to paint like Corot, the farther I got from it and I ended à la Chagall."
title: The Poet with the Birds
